--- title: "The Great Coffee Caper" subtitle: "Exploring Discernment and Appreciation of Different Roasts" author: - name: "Cristina Lafuente" affiliations: - name: "School of Information, University of Arizona" description: "Evaluation of data recovered from coffee taste test" format: html: code-tools: true code-overflow: wrap code-line-numbers: true embed-resources: true editor: visual code-annotations: hover execute: warning: true --- ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(here) ``` ::: ## Dataset ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} coffeeData <- readr::read_csv(('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2024/2024-05-14/coffee_survey.csv')) ``` ::: The Coffee Data comes from a coffee taste test held on YouTube in Oct 2023. Data was self reported by participants. It was aggregated by a data blogger named Robert McKeon Aloe who analyzed the data the following month. The Dimensions of the data are: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} dim(coffeeData) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 4042 57 ``` ::: ::: as well as the reason why you chose this dataset. Make sure to load the data and use inline code for some of this information. ## Questions Question 1: Do people tend to quantify acidity and bitterness in coffee as acidity and bitterness distinctly and correctly? Question 2: Does political affiliation play any part in coffee preference? ## Analysis plan - A plan for answering each of the questions including the variables involved, variables to be created (if any), external data to be merged in (if any). ```{=html}
